docs.snippet: Bob Turley, a Cy Young-winning, right-handed pitcher whose blazing fastball bore in on baffled hitters like a dissolving aspirin and lifted the  Yankees  to a come-from-behind victory over the Milwaukee Braves in the 1958 World Series, died in Atl...
docs.lead_paragraph:
Bob Turley, a Cy Young-winning, right-handed pitcher whose blazing fastball bore in on baffled hitters like a dissolving aspirin and lifted the Yankees to a come-from-behind victory over the Milwaukee Braves in the 1958 World Series, died in Atlanta on Saturday. He was 82. 
 
Turley, who lived in Alpharetta, Ga., died in hospice care at Lenbrook, a retirement community in Atlanta. The cause was liver cancer, his son, Terry, told The Baltimore Sun.
docs.abstract: Bob Turley, Cy Young Award-winning pitcher who lifted the New York Yankees to 1958 World Series victory, dies at age 82. Photo (M)

headline.main: Bob Turley, Yankee With a Blazing Fastball, Dies at 82

docs.snippet: Oregon State Hospital features a museum that pays tribute to the movie “One Flew Over the Cuckoo’s Nest” and explores mental health treatments of the past....
docs.lead_paragraph: Oregon State Hospital features a museum that pays tribute to the movie “One Flew Over the Cuckoo’s Nest” and explores mental health treatments of the past.
docs.abstract: Salem Journal; Oregon State Hospital in Salem features a museum that pays tribute to the movie One Flew Over the Cuckoo’s Nest, which was filmed there in the 1970s; it is one of the few mental health museums around the world that are part of a still functioning hospital; museum explores mental health treatments of the past, good and bad.

headline.seo: ‘Cuckoo’s Nest’ Hospital Is Now a Museum
headline.main: Once a ‘Cuckoo’s Nest,’ Now a Museum

docs.snippet: The gun bills that the Senate is about to consider offer a new example of the skill with which its leader, Harry Reid of Nevada, evolves on issues....
docs.lead_paragraph: The gun bills that the Senate is about to consider offer a new example of the skill with which its leader, Harry Reid of Nevada, evolves on issues.
docs.abstract: Sen Harry Reid's evolution from gun rights proponent to shepherd of legislation that would expand background checks, among other gun control measures, is indicative of his politics and leadership style; Reid is preparing to bring the most expansive package of gun safety legislation in a decade to the Senate floor.

headline.seo: Harry Reid Draws on Political Calculus as He Leads Senate
headline.main: As Views Shift on Guns, Reid Corrals Senate

docs.snippet: Before appearances at public forums, the city’s mayoral candidates wait together in tight quarters, an often tense scene akin to a locker room being shared by rival teams....
docs.lead_paragraph: Before appearances at public forums, the city’s mayoral candidates wait together in tight quarters, an often tense scene akin to a locker room being shared by rival teams.
docs.abstract: Candidates for New York City mayor, sparring publicly at seemingly endless series of debates, often wait together in tight quarters before appearances, creating tense scene much like a locker room being shared by rival sports teams.

headline.seo: Sparring Both On and Off the Debate Stage in the Mayoral Race
headline.main: On and Off the Debate Stage, Candidates Spar in the Mayoral Race
